import sys

# Read data
A, B, C, K = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())

# Initialize variables
max_sum = 0

# Calculate max sum
if K <= A:
    max_sum = K
elif K <= A + B:
    max_sum = A
else:
    max_sum = A - (K - A - B)

# Print result
print(max_sum)

import sys

# Get input
A, B, C, K = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())

# Initialize variables
sum = 0

# If K is less than or equal to A, then add K to sum
if K <= A:
    sum += K
# If K is greater than A, then add A to sum
else:
    sum += A
    K -= A

# If K is less than or equal to B, then subtract K from sum
if K <= B:
    sum -= K
# If K is greater than B, then subtract B from sum
else:
    sum -= B
    K -= B

# If K is less than or equal to C, then subtract K from sum
if K <= C:
    sum -= K
# If K is greater than C, then subtract C from sum
else:
    sum -= C
    K -= C

# Print sum
print(sum)

import sys

def main():
    # Read input
    a, b, c, k = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())
    # Sort cards by value
    cards = sorted([a, b, c])

    # If we can pick up all cards, then the sum is the sum of all cards
    if k <= a + b + c:
        print(sum(cards))
    # If we can only pick up one card, then the sum is the max of all cards
    elif k == 1:
        print(max(cards))
    # Otherwise, we can only pick up one of each card, so the sum is 2
    else:
        print(2)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
